X 1 X 2 X 3 X 4 vs. X 1 X 2 X 3 X 4 X 1 X 2 X X
Proposed structure learning methods for arbitrary discrete graphs Methods are theoretically rigorous and easily adapted to corrupted observations

sections.heading: Corollary
sections.text: When G is a tree, inverse covariance matrix of sufficient statistics on nodes is graph-structured

sections.heading: Corollary
sections.text: When G is a tree, inverse covariance matrix of sufficient statistics on nodes is graph-structured

sections.heading: Based on penalized MLE for Gaussians
sections.text:
When does graphical Lasso succeed for non-Gaussians?
For binary Ising models with singleton separators, the graphical Lasso succeeds w.h.p. when n d 2 log p Graphical Lasso completely unrelated to MLE for non-Gaussians Population results imply graphical Lasso is inconsistent in general
